docs.lead_paragraph: Two kidney transplant patients who contracted brain infections raised the question of whether people with certain neurological conditions should be barred as donors.

headline.sub: Brain Infection in Two Patients Raises Issue;

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress finally repealed a ban on federal financing for needle exchange programs, but lawmakers need to show more courage fighting for sound medical judgment.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Krebs shared a Nobel Prize in 1992 for discovering a crucial bodily process that helps govern the movement of muscles, the shape and division of cells, and even learning and memory.

headline.main: Edwin Krebs Dies at 91; Discovered a Crucial Bodily Process
headline.print_headline: Edwin Krebs, 91; Discovered a Crucial Bodily Process

docs.snippet: Dr. Krebs shared a Nobel Prize in 1992 for discovering a crucial bodily process that helps govern the movement of muscles, the shape and division of cells, and even learning and memory.

docs.lead_paragraph: For all the changes the Senate health care bill portends, at least one thing should hold constant: those ubiquitous ''ask your doctor'' television advertisements for prescription drugs. Lobbyists turned back efforts in both the Senate and the House to end the business-tax deductions that drug makers can take for advertising.
docs.abstract: Drug industry lobbyists turned back efforts in health care overhaul to end business-tax deductions that drug makers can take for advertisements; United States is one of only two countries that allow direct-to-consumer advertising of prescription drugs; supporters say commercials educate patients and save lives, while critics say they help drive up health care costs by encouraging consumers to take more expensive and sometimes less effective drugs, in some cases for invented diseases (M)
